skill.name: python-packaging
skill.description: Create distributable Python packages with proper project structure, setup.py/pyproject.toml, and publishing to PyPI. Use when packaging Python libraries, creating CLI tools, or distributing Python code.
skill.summary: Create distributable Python packages with proper project structure, setup.py/pyproject.toml, and pub...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with only educational content about Python packaging. No executable scripts, network calls, file access, or code execution paths present.

content.value_statement: Packaging a Python project often causes structure and metadata errors. This skill provides clear layouts, configuration examples, and publishing steps to create distributable packages.
actual_capabilities: Explain src and flat layouts for package structure
Provide pyproject.toml examples with PEP 517 and PEP 621 metadata
Show how to define CLI entry points using Click or argparse
Outline build and upload steps with build and twine
Share GitHub Actions workflow examples for publishing
limitations: Does not run build or upload commands
Does not generate or edit project files
Does not validate project specific metadata

use_cases.title: Package a reusable module
use_cases.description: Design a clean structure and metadata for a shared Python library.

use_cases.title: Ship a command line tool
use_cases.description: Define entry points and release a CLI package to PyPI.

use_cases.title: Automate publishing
use_cases.description: Set up a release workflow with build and upload steps.

prompt_templates.title: Starter package
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a minimal src layout and pyproject.toml for a small Python library named acme-tools.

prompt_templates.title: Add CLI entry point
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to add a click based CLI entry point called acme to an existing package.

prompt_templates.title: Build and publish
prompt_templates.prompt: List the steps to build wheels and publish to TestPyPI and PyPI using twine.

prompt_templates.title: CI release workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a GitHub Actions workflow that builds and uploads on release creation.

output_examples.input: I need a simple pyproject.toml and folder layout for a library.
output: Use a src layout with a package folder and tests.
Define build system and project metadata in pyproject.toml.
Add dependencies and optional dev tools.
Include README and LICENSE for packaging.

best_practices: Use a src layout for safer imports
Test installs in a clean environment

faq.question: Is this compatible with modern Python packaging?
faq.answer: Yes, it focuses on pyproject.toml and PEP 517 and PEP 621 standards.

faq.question: What can this skill not do?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and examples but does not execute builds or uploads.

faq.question: Can it help with CI or GitHub Actions?
faq.answer: Yes, it includes an example workflow for publishing on release.

faq.question: Does it collect or send my data?
faq.answer: No, the content contains no data collection or network actions.

faq.question: What if my build fails?
faq.answer: Check build requirements, metadata fields, and run twine check on artifacts.

faq.question: How does it compare with Poetry or Flit?
faq.answer: It documents multiple backends and explains when each is suitable.
